content:

If, I save it in Drafts and then go to the Drafts mailbox and print from there, it works as expected, but that's a lot of extra steps.

It seems this same bug happened a number of years ago: [Can no longer print a DRAFT message open in compose] and was classified as a bug and fixed. Hopefully the same can happen again?

Thanks!

title: Last upgrade of Thunderbird to my Linux computer is not working properly
content:
At the beginning of October - I believe or thereabouts, my computer received an update of Thunderbird which almost literally exploded on my computer. By exploded, I mean that the size of the screen is larger than my computer screen (computer screen actual size: 1920 wide by 1080 high). Worse still, the update has limited my scrolling so that I cannot scroll to reach parts of the program that are off-screen. (Please note that my descriptions are not technical, but how it appears to me as I am limited by whatever is wrong with the Thunderbird program update.)

On the version of Thunderbird I had before the update, I had set the size of the screen font to 20pts, picas, whatever (because I have aging vision). After the update, I did find the setting for the size of print and put it at its lowest setting 9pts. It reduced the size of the onscreen print somewhat, but not to 9pts. When I look at 9 pts in my wordprocessor, the print is duly small.

To compare what I see on the Thunderbird screen with what I see in my wordprocessor, Libre Write, I took a screenshot of an email title and pasted it in my wordprocessor and then repeated the title at 14pts (the size I use when I write) at 9pts (the size I changed in Thuderbird), and 20 Pts (my original font-size with Thunderbird). Below you will find the screenshot so you can compare for youself.

So that's the first problem I have with this Thunderbird update.

The second problem I have is that scrolling has become limited, so while in the column that shows the email accouonts, you can see "Local Folders", but you can't scroll past Local Folders. This is a real problem for me because I subscribe to a number of newsletters and move them to folders I have created under Local folders. I do this to keep my email accounts from being over loaded. While I can transfer them automatically to the Local Folders, I can't access them because the program will not let me scroll past the Local Folders.

Because of the way this progam update works, I can't find/reach the Delete Account button that should be at the bottom of Account Settings, but since the scrolling stops at the Email Signature box and goes no further, I can't delete the account.

Why do I want to delete an account. Trying to work things out by myself, I thought I would remove three of my minor email accounts to another Linux mail app, and that I might then be able to scroll to the folders under the Local Folders and, at least, have a bare minimum functioning of Thunderbird.

I went through this whole thing with David, a top 10 contributor and he recommended i put the whole shebang up on this support list. But truthfully, I don't think this is something any user, no matter how expert, can help me with. This is truly a Thunderbird problem and I don't know how to reach Thunderbird technicians.

Please let me know if you have any ideas on how to get Thunderbird's attention. Any help is appreciated.
creator: bdjim

I seems like this used to be straightforward. I'd search, get a list of found emails, and I could then just copy them to a new folder. When I just tried this, everything seemed to have changed. My options are now to Move the found emails to a different folder or to Save as Search Folder, which doesn't help me at all.

Please advise? I find it hard to believe that there is no longer any way to copy over search results.

title: One of my Gmail accounts stopped working with Thunderbird
content:
When I open Thunderbird, I get this error message: "The STAT command did not succeed. Error getting message number and sizes. Mail server pop.googlemail.com responded: [AUTH] Invalid credentials."

I can not receive or send emails on Thunderbird with a particular email address, however if I use another email address, it works without errors. When I attempt to send an email, I get this error message, "Login to server smtp.googlemail.com with username (Redacted) failed." Or the following error message occurs, "Sending of the message failed. Unable to authenticate to Outgoing server (SMTP) smtp.googlemail.com. Please check the password and verify the 'Authentication method' in 'Account Settings | Outgoing server (SMTP)'."

I have followed all of the instructions for setting up the Oauth token and allowing cookies and Java script, but without success. This problem started when I received an email from Google saying that I needed to validate my account for security reasons. When they asked me to enter my account's password, I failed to do it correctly because they would not allow me to paste it in and they would not show the characters which I was typing in as anything but dots. The result was that they indicated that they were invalidating my account because of too many failed attempts to log on to my Google account. I have since then been able to log on there, but they offer no help in recovering the operation of my email account on Thunderbird. Incidentally, this troubled email account works okay on the Google Email internet site, just not with Thunderbird.

Any help that you can provide will be much appreciated!

title: Can I use the same default folder/accounts with two startup drives - Mac
content:
I have two startup drives on our Mac. One uses an older OS (10.11) and one uses 10.15. I have to have the two startup drives because of software limitations; a number of applications we use can't be upgraded to work with more current OS options.

We use Thunderbird for our email accounts, keeping track of at least 40 different addresses for personal and work purposes, and have been happy with how it works. This is installed on the "older" system start-up drive.

I would like to install Thunderbird on the more updated drive too but was wondering if I can, somehow, just point Thunderbird to the existing default folder on the other drive? The goal is, when I. use the new system, that I can continue where I left off with Thunderbird. Using the same default folder would mean, hopefully, that any changes/updates would continuously show up in whichever OS I'm using.

I'm hoping this makes sense. . . .anyone know if it can be done without copying the folder somewhere else? I want the one folder to serve both Thunderbirds so that it's always current.

Thanks for any advice.

title: No puedo recibir correos desde la actualización de Thunderbird a la versión 115
content:
Desde hace una semana que se me actualizó automáticamente Thunderbird a la versión 115 no recibe los correos. Si puedo enviar. Mi cuenta de correo es profesional (xxxx@xxxx.e.telefonica.net) y el servidor es outlook.office365.com. Si entro a mi correo desde outlook web todo funciona (enviados y recibidos). Pero si intento recibir con Thunderbird115 sale el mensaje abajo "Servidor contactado, enviando información de inicio de sesión"y después de unos segundos sale el mensaje de que no hay mensajes nuevos. Y si los hay, lo puedo comprobar si accedo a outlook web. He revisado la configuración de la cuenta en Thunderbird con mi proveedor IT y está todo correcto: Servidor de correo POP: outlook.office365.com Puerto: 995 SSL/TLS OAuth2

Servidor de salida(SMTP): smtp.office365.com Puerto: 587 STARTTLS OAuth2 Tengo también configurada otra cuenta de gmail y con ella no tengo ningún problema. ¿Sabrían decirme cual es el problema y como puedo resoverlo? Tengo desde tiempo Thunderbird y guardo muchísimo correo distribuido en muchísimas carpetas con sus correspondientes reglas para el almacenaje, muchos direcciones, etc. Sería muy complicado para mi cambiar de aplicación de correo. Muchas gracias.

title: Some Messages Take Much Time To Switch From Unread to Read... (115.3.2 64bit)
content: When I click on new messages, some of them either: (1) take a few seconds to switch to "read", (2) require a second or third click before switching to "read", or (3) take a *VERY* long time (worst case: 58 seconds!) to clear/switch it to "read" status. In the "Reading & Display" section of settings, I chose to "Automatically mark messages as read", "Immediately on display". I also changed the settings to 1-second (or more) delay, but the message "read"-status CHANGE always takes longer than the time I set. My account is POP. Internet speed (problems) can be ruled out as: Ping=2, Down=780, Up=940 (FIOS). I can compact the Inbox without any trouble so corruption is most likely not an issue. I've removed most messages from my Inbox, but the switch from unread-to-read status is still just as slow. The status switch delays appear to be irrespective of message size, number of photos/graphics/links, etc.... I can scroll through and read entire messages as I'm waiting for the switch to read status to occur, so it's *NOT* waiting delaying due to downloading of message contents or display delays. Finally, I must stress - before I "upgraded" to "Supernova", this problem didn't exist! The switch from Unread to Read was INSTANT as I zipped through hundreds of new messages daily. Please Help! Thanks!! :-)
creator: LREmery

title: Attached photos do not display
content:
Expansion on my earlier request as I have not heard back from anyone.

1. Running Windows 11 with latest update 2. Running Thunderbird 115.3.2 (64-bit) 3. Until the Thunderbird update a week or so ago, all was working correctly. 4. Now, in the inbox the attached security cameras jpg photos with each alert email do not open. 5. Yes, in the setup menu, jpg are set to open with default Photos app/program. 6. Clicking on any jpg attachment does nothing. They will not open. 7. Saving these same jpg files to another folder outside of Thunderbird and then clicking on them bring up "Sorry, Photos can't open this file because the format is currently unsupported, or the file is corrupted." 8. WHEN I delete one of these security camera emails with 3-5 attached photos, I can do to TRASH and open that email and ALL of the photos display just as expected -- as they should in the INBOX! 9. IF I copy this same email's photos to the same folder as before with the inbox jpgs, they now open immediately. 10. It appears that the INBOX coding is not recording the jpgs in the proper format -- some bit is wrong and hence blocking it from opening. 11. HOWEVER, as far as I know now, this only starts happens after I shut down my desktop computer for the night. In the morning when I boot my computer and open Thunderbird and check my overnight security camera emails, none of the jpg pictures will display. The words in the email are correct. 12. THEN at some point overnight, sometimes the date/time stamp shows up as 4:00 a.m. or 5:00 a.m. or 7:00 a.m. (or any minute therein) AND all the emails following that time display the jpgs as usual (until the next night)! Go back to the earlier emails and they still do NOT display -- as though the jpg file is corrupted. Again, delete that email and go to trash and it opens immediately! 13. All other emails overnight behave normally -- advertisements from different companies come through as normal. 14. What more can I say? I've been using Mozilla Firefox and Thunderbird for many years.
creator: OcklawahaMan

title: Updated Thunderbird Version - I have questions
content:
Greetings Mozilla,

I'm technology adverse but I have been using Thunderbird as my email client for many years. Recently the auto updated my version to: Version 115.3.1 (64 bit)

So the look and feel of the screen is a bit different and there are a couple rudimentary actions I'm having trouble with;

1. I used to be able to see a Tag button that would let me tag emails really quickly. Now I have to right click and scroll to Tag etc. How can I get a Tag button back?

2. Similarly, when I click on an individual message, there used to be a button on the right that said Options and the dropdown would Show Remote Content. Well that Options button is gone and I can't figure out how to show remote content of my incoming emails.

I apologize these issues are so pedestrian... but I'm having trouble with them.

Thanks so much,

Peggi Silver Spring, MD

title: GMail folders no longer in a [GMail] parent folder - can I revert?
content: So my Thunderbird updated today to 115.3.1 Previously for each of my GMail accounts I had a [GMail] parent folder, and the Drafts, Sent mail, Spam, All mail, and Bin were all in there. Nice and tidy. Now, there is no [GMail] parent folder and they are at the top level. But I have dozens of email accounts, so having them in a [GMail] parent folder meant they took up less space and it was easier to see new messages on other accounts. I've tried creating a new folder, but these (Spam, All mail etc) cannot be moved into it. Is there any way of restoring the [GMail] parent folder for these? Thank you in advance.
creator: richard162

title: View multiple accounts/inboxes at the same time (similar to Apple Mail)
content: Hello! How can I highlight and view my multiple inboxes at the same time? I am coming over from Apple Mail, and I have multiple email accounts; Personal, personal work, bills and utilities, junk mail, etc. In Apple Mail, I would hold command or shift, and could highlight a couple of email inbox accounts and see all the emails together. I can not seem to find the key combination in Thunderbird. I would love to ditch Apple's eco system, but that one feature I'm still puzzled with on how to do it. The individual email accounts are setup in Thunderbird, that part is good. Just can't view them at the same time. Thank you so very much!
creator: Thomas.J.Cee

title: v115 and all the required hacks
content:
This is an observation from a very long-term Thunderbird user.

Not sure what the developers have in mind but the trendy stuff needs to stop. Moving the tab bar and re-skinning with black-on-dark is unacceptable. Have had to hack it twice to make things usable and visible. Forcing users to resort to using Reddit to change .css to fix things is nuts. Not sure if it's an error or deliberate "technical steering"?

What's the point of this? Mobile and driving with a finger? Keep in mind the world does NOT revolve around mobile regardless of phone-obsessed fools opinions. If this is the planned direction it will result in a barrage of complaints from angry computer users.

Stay strong and smart. Avoid overt trendy crap.
creator: rockney85881

If any column is positioned so its LEFT border touches any of the small 1-character columns (such as attachments, read status, or junk), the CURSOR will NOT even change to a double-arrow to allow you to adjust. Same goes for the RIGHT border of the rightmost column... (?) Please help! Thanks!! :-)

title: Sorting By "Order Received" Has Changed!? (115.3.2 64bit)
content:
I used to be able to sort messages by "Order Received" WITHOUT displaying it as a COLUMN in the display. NOW - if I don't have "Order Received" displaying as a column, the "Order Received" sort option is "greyed-out"! For me, at least, the information showing in the "Order Received" column is useless and unwanted, and I hate to waste COLUMN SPACE to display information that I don't need. Please allow users to sort our messages by "Order Received" WITHOUT having to display it in a column. Thanks! :-)

Since I initially wrote the above text, someone made the following suggestion which helped a lot, but didn't SOLVE the problem: As with your problem the sort option for "Order Received" is greyed out. I have managed to fudge it by displaying the "Order Received" column, enabling the sort by "Order Received" then "undisplaying" the "Order Received" column. The sort order is retained.

I'm requesting that Thunderbird Supernova programmers please FIX the program so it can sort by any possible category REGARDLESS of whether a column is/was displayed for it. Thanks very much!  :-)
creator: LREmery

title: Keeps downloading thousands of gmail emails.   There are not thousands of emails to download
content:
I was hoping to get to the actual customer support as I've exhausted the forum I think.

Thunderbird keeps telling me it is downloading <number> of 26,800+ or sometimes it is of 36,000+ emails. I've deleted the the pop file (even though its IMAP) I deleted the mail file. I re-download and reinstalled. And still when I launch it starts downloading this huge chunk of emails.

At the server, there are less than 500 emails on the server. No idea where it is finding tens of thousands of emails from.

As you can imagine, Thunderbird freezes up and might be responsible for my computer shutting down without warning from time to time as I imagine that take up a lot of the swap memory.

This is a gmail account. Its not doing this with any of the other non gmail accounts. Is there some know bug with thunderbird and gmail maybe?

I did not delete completely, as I have about 7 email ids in thunderbird - I just installed over the top hoping any glitch would get overwritten, but no luck.

Image of the note included, just so you see I am not dreaming.

Thunderbird 115.3.4 64 bit version on Win 10

title: Domain Change Settings Question - Manual Config - Folder Organization
content: Hello All, I recently changed my service provider from GoDaddy to Strikingly. I've changed the settings again in Thunderbird, but the account is hardwired to POP3 (GoDaddy) instead of IMAP (Strikingly) and won't link to the server. I assume I will need to do a manual account configuration to change this. Before jumping in I just need to warm up my cold feet and make SURE that when I do this I won't be losing all of the folder organization for years and years of business emails which only exists in Thunderbird. Please, please reassure me! Thank you so much, M. Britz

title: Need help with recovering a very old Thunderbird Profile backup
content:

I have the old Profiles directory backed up. Backed up as a copy (not as an export or zip). I've not been able to get Thunderbird to load the messages however.

I've tried the various instructions for creating new profiles, pointing to the directory, editing the profiles.ini (both relatively=1 and explictly=0) and I don't see the messages showing up. The existing documentation doesn't seem to cover whatever problem I'm running into.

I'm not seeing error messages show up either so I'm not sure what to do at this point. Any recommendations on what I can do to try to recover these old emails? I see the headers are there but the body is ?compressed?. It's not std ascii.

Thank you.

title: Thunderbird Supernova načtení .eml
content: Bohužel jsme zjistili, že pokud chceme načíst .eml soubor vygenerovaný naším ERP systémem, tak zatímco starší verze předmět správně stejně jako Outlook vyplnila, v nové verzi Thunderbird předmět po otevření asociovaného .eml úplně chybí, vyplní se jen adresát. U posílání vícero faktur je to bohužel velká nepříjemnost (testováno se stejným .eml souborem, kde Outlook předmět vyplní, ale nový Thunderbird Supernova nikoliv). Takže bychom byli rádi, kdyby toto bylo opět funkční, případně pokud by někdo věděl, kde tohle lze na nové verzi zapnout, předem děkuji.
